title: How to Turn Your Wii Controller Into a Mouse

steps.headline: Buy a Bluetooth dongle if your computer is not already Bluetooth-enabled.
Connect and install the Bluetooth dongle on your computer.
Download a program from the following Web site corresponding to your operating system:

steps.headline: Open Bluetooth Devices (or My Bluetooth Places) by either clicking the icon on your desktop, the tiny B icon in your system tray near the clock, or opening it through the Start menu.
Click Add... (or if you are using "My Bluetooth Places" click "Next").
Check the box next to "My device is set up and ready to be found" and Click Next (or if you are using "My Bluetooth Places" select "Human Interface Device" and click "Next)".
Press 1 and 2 on your Wiimote when it says "Searching Devices" to connect the device.
Now open the program GlovePie (if you are using Windows), go to GUI, click Detect output to emulate and select mouse as an Output device.
steps.description: Select the operation you want to convert (like left button, right button..). Than click Detect input, press the desirable button on the Wiimote and click "Apply". Repeat this for all operations you want to convert.

steps.headline: When you finish with the setup click Run and test your Wiimote.

(or if you are using "My Bluetooth Places" click "Next"). Check the box next to "My device is set up and ready to be found" and Click Next (or if you are using "My Bluetooth Places" select "Human Interface Device" and click "Next)". Press 1 and 2 on your Wiimote when it says "Searching Devices" to connect the device. Now open the program GlovePie (if you are using Windows), go to GUI, click Detect output to emulate and select mouse as an Output device. Select the operation you want to convert (like left button, right button..). Than click Detect input, press the desirable button on the Wiimote and click "Apply". Repeat this for all operations you want to convert. When you finish with the setup click Run and test your Wiimote.
